text:
So i seem to be running into issues with dependent fields on forms when using a single checkbox on the form. I have it set to where:

``` 
If [checkbox field name] 
   is equal to
   "No"
then show:
[text field]
```
Issue is, when it is unchecked, the `text field` doesnt show at all
the only options are `is equal to` and `is not empty` both of these scenarios dont help with what I am intending to do
Hi anyone know if I can send specific data to webhook on workflow?
with general webhooks, it will send the entire record.  If you use workflow extensions, you can choose what it will send
Hi <@UFBNA9K9A>, where I can find this workflow extensions?

You can build a node setup to automaticaly push your items via ftp for build. use vinyl-ftp. You can create this as part of a deploy. I've gotten this far in one of my repos.

You can also use it to see if anything has been changed and compare it to your local files, but then you would need to figure out some sort of behavior to change filenames or something to prevent overwriting these files
Here is our documentation for those <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/workflow-extensions/workflow-extensions-overview>

merging these files, etc. That is where I decided I couldn't make this work.  You could probably create a virtual folder and bring these items into a repo and script a way to commit these items. This would allow people to work inside HubSpot and offline as well.
But this all gets very complicated because of the nature of the filesystem
Here is something I found - not sure if it is in perfect working order but I can share this sauce
Recently my inline blog post editor stopped working. Lost the ability to click and edit post body and other text modules within the template. Has anyone experienced this before?
<@U795QFHDE> we had this issue with a vendor called Concurra where their JS was causing the editor to break and not be clickable
thank you <@UFBNA9K9A>
<@U2H3TT8F2> Thanks! Is there an easy way to identify if this is what is occurring for us? I'm not sure why it would be as no changes have been made today. Maybe inspecting in the browser?
another way to do what AJâ€™s saying is using `{{ request.postDict.inpageEditorUI }}` which returns true if user is in page editor, and undefined if not
if i recall there was a JS error in the console of the editor page
Then again, i think someone from HS helped me diagnose it from a support ticket, i cant recall as it was awhile ago and we ditched Concurra way back
I normally do that by using `{{ request.headers }}` and checking if one of the headers is `<http://preview.hs-sites.com|preview.hs-sites.com>` or something to that nature.
That will render true in the backend and the preview window, but not on the live site.
Hi <@UFBNA9K9A>, I create the application (in private) in my developer account, and I will integrate with my client portal, but don't worked
I was solved
